column4: hiya.. im having a big problem, i want to install ubuntu but the 6.06.1 amd64 installer cd is trying to force me to format my partition i want to install on.. but its a valid ext3 partition and i do not wish to copy back all my data, i moved everyting on that partition to a temp dir.. is there anyway to bypass this thing?
does the ext3 take up the entire drive? I think you need by default at least three partitions, boot, swap, and whatever else
i have swap and the rest is ext3.. this worked before on a 6.06 disk i lost.. now its forcing me to format or it wont install :/
damn, in that case, no clue. If its any consolation my gf's last 6.06 install erased her Windows mft, had to format the whole damn thing :-P
